1.review_title: Not a match ball as they claim but a decent ball nonetheless.
1.text: Background: Player, coach, match ball collector and aficionada. Former employee at soccer.com.I've had this ball for almost a year and got it based on the advertising that claims it's a match ball. It is not. It is a decent training ball.What makes this merely a training ball is the suppleness of the ball. There isn't great bounce to this ball and that translates into little explosiveness when coming off your foot. A match ball wraps around your foot and bounces off your foot but this ball feels plasticky like a futsal ball and almost hurts if you kick it as hard as I can because it lacks suppleness. For $26, it's a decent ball. Would I buy another one, no.It's a good value for the money but the claims that it's a match ball are false. Match balls have a stamp of approval from either FIFA or the NFHS.

2.text: Me agrado lo rápido que llegó  ya que era un regalo para navidad.

4.text: My kids just recently started a new season of soccer and my sons soccer ball was flat and couldn't be aired up. After some searching we got him this ball as a replacement. They do ship the ball deflated so that it takes up less space, so make sure that you have a ball pump to air it up. That wasn't a big deal for us though since we have multiple pumps.Unfortunately the first time that we tried to air this up it went flat right away after it was filled up. There was a leak on the of the seams of the ball.  We contacted the company right away and they quickly shipped us a new one right away. The replacement arrived very quickly and is working perfectly for him.

5.text: Good feel to the ball. Unfortunately doesn’t hold air too well. Use the pump.

6.text: Been playing for nearly 40 years.  This ball is great for those pickup games when you want to play with something nice.  High quality for training and normal games.

7.text: Great soccer ball, for its price.  My son Needed a new soccer ball for Spring, Handles well, and seemingly well made.Pretty easy to inflate, but needed to use my sons pump from his soccer bag as pump it comes with does not have a needle.Stoked on this purchase.

9.text: Just wish it was already pumped up

11.text: Arrived on time and in good condition.

12.review_title: Good quality ball. But bad pump design
12.text:
The media could not be loaded.
                



 Like the ball alot. Dislike how cheap the pump is.

14.text: I have done some side by side comparisons with this and a major European league official ball. It compares favorably for almost half the price. The stitching allows for durability even when the ball has high air pressure. The included pump is a nice little addition. It is small and slick. The way it allows to stow away the needle should keep in from getting bent or broken when not in use. My only complaint for the ball, albeit a very minor one, is the "FOOTY" words being so large. It is a little distracting.

15.text: This is a decent ball.  I would not consider this a professional match ball, but it is suitable for any level of practice or for youth games.  The texture is soft but the overall feel of the ball is a bit on the heavy side.  It seems durable which is good.  I think it is a fine ball for training and pickup or youth games.  The air pump that is included is very cheap and broke when using, so don't count on it.

16.text: Nice size soccer ball not to small. It did get an easy tear already after being kicked on to the side walk, got a good scuff tear do not as durable as I thought.

17.text: It is a nice soccer ball and the material is thick and durable. It also comes along with a mini-pump which is convenient.

18.text: I liked this ball, bring the pump to inflate it.  good quality for the price

19.text: This soccer ball is high quality with a professional design - the quality in the product description is really evidenced - Its good overall for youth and kids who can use this on a daily basis in casual or training outdoor playing or also indoor.

20.review_title: Nice ball, inflated quickly and easily
20.text: Seems very durable, it has held air fully for almost 2 weeks, sometimes balls that are less expensive need to be touched up, not this one.

21.review_title: Need a good quality soccer ball?
21.text: The Good:-High quality-Looks good-Holds air-Great for rec or league playThe Bad:-NoneThe Bottom Line:Our kid uses this Footy soccer ball in his rec league and the kids like it. They like the gold pattern on it and the ball is well built. It does come deflated so you need to pump it up first. Overall, I would recommend this Footy soccer ball for its performance and construction.

22.text: Very good quality and ball seems durable. Looks great and exactly like pictured. Came with a pump which was very easy to use, took just a few minutes to blow up the ball. Overall very happy with my purchase.

25.text: Very impressed with the quality of the ball, and the included pump worked great and was very easy to use. Love how the ball looks too! Definitely deserves 5☆

 My German Shepherd was playing with this while I wasn’t watching and it didn’t pop. Must mean it’s pretty good quality as she has popped my other basketballs and soccer balls before. Comes with a pump so super easy to inflate. Can’t beat the quality for the price.
